en: Then Jehovah answered Job out of the whirlwind, and said,
hmr: Chun, thlivira inthawkin LALPA chun Job chu a hung dawn a, a hril tah a:

en: Who is this that darkeneth counsel By words without knowledge?
hmr: “Hrietna bo thuhaia, Thurâwn sukthimtu hi tu am a ni leh?

en: Gird up now thy loins like a man; For I will demand of thee, and declare thou unto me.
hmr: Pasal angin tuhin i dier kei la, Thu indawn ka ti cheh a, i mi hrilfie ding a nih.

en: Where wast thou when I laid the foundations of the earth? Declare, if thou hast understanding.
hmr: Hnuoi lungphûmhai ka phûm laiin nang chu khaw lai am i um a? Hriethiemna i nei chun mi hril rawh.

en: Who determined the measures thereof, if thou knowest? Or who stretched the line upon it?
hmr: Tuin am chu chu lienziehai chu a riruong a, I hriet ngei maw! Annawleh, a chunga chun tuin am a thlûr chu a siem a?

en: Whereupon were the foundations thereof fastened? Or who laid the corner-stone thereof,
hmr: A lungphûmhai chu khâwlai am an innghat a na? Annawleh, a kia lung chu tuin am a phûm a?

en: When the morning stars sang together, And all the sons of God shouted for joy?
hmr: Zîng arasihai chun hla an sak tâwlin, Pathien naupahai chu iengtik khan am hlimin an khêk a?

en: Or who shut up the sea with doors, When it brake forth, as if it had issued out of the womb;
hmr: Annawleh, sula inthawka a hung ṭe thla laiin, Tuisuoriet chu tuin am kawtkhârhai chu a khârpêk a;

en: When I made clouds the garment thereof, And thick darkness a swaddling-band for it,
hmr: Sûm chu a silfênah ka siem a, Inthim sâmupa ka tuom lai khan;

en: And marked out for it my bound, And set bars and doors,
hmr: A ramrihai ka ruotpêk a, Kawtkhârhai le palhai ka sie a;

en: And said, Hitherto shalt thou come, but no further; And here shall thy proud waves be stayed?
hmr: ‘Hi chen hi nang hung la, khêl naw la, I tuifâwn chapotakhai chu hi chen hin châwl an tih’ ka ti lai khan?

en: Hast thou commanded the morning since thy days began, And caused the dayspring to know its place;
hmr: “I nihai inṭana inthawk ta hrimin, zîngkâr dâm hi thu i pêk ta hlakin, Vârṭien chu a hun hre dingin în umtir ta hlak am,

en: That it might take hold of the ends of the earth, And the wicked be shaken out of it?
hmr: Hnuoi inkhumna chu hlîm ding le, A sûnga mi rilo chu sêpdawka a um theina dingin?

en: It is changed as clay under the seal; And all things stand forth as a garment:
hmr: Namna hnuoia pilpawk angin sukdanglamin a um a, Silfên angin piengzie a hung nei a.

en: And from the wicked their light is withholden, And the high arm is broken.
hmr: Mi riloa inthawkin an var chu cheltângin a um a, Kut insâng khawm chu sukthliekin a um bawk a.

en: Hast thou entered into the springs of the sea? Or hast thou walked in the recesses of the deep?
hmr: Tuisuoriet hnârahai chun i lût ta hlak am? Annawleh, li inthûk rila chun i fe ta hlak am?

en: Have the gates of death been revealed unto thee? Or hast thou seen the gates of the shadow of death?
hmr: Thina kawtkhârhai chu i kuomah suklang a ni ta hlak am? Annawleh, thina hlim kawtkhârhai chu i hmu hlak am?

en: Hast thou comprehended the earth in its breadth? Declare, if thou knowest it all.
hmr: Hnuoi khang lienzie chu i hriet ta hlak am? Hril rawh khai, a rênga i hriet vawng chun.

en: Where is the way to the dwelling of light? And as for darkness, where is the place thereof,
hmr: Var umna hmun lampui chu khâwlai am a na? Inthimna hi teh, a umna hmun khâwlai am a na?

en: That thou shouldest take it to the bound thereof, And that thou shouldest discern the paths to the house thereof?
hmr: Chutaka chun i va fe ding ni ta sienla, Chutaka in chu i va thlierhran ding ni ta sienla?

en: Doubtless, thou knowest, for thou wast then born, And the number of thy days is great!
hmr: I hriet ngei maw, nang chu i pieng dai tah a, I nihai khawm a hung tam ta êm a!

en: Hast thou entered the treasuries of the snow, Or hast thou seen the treasures of the hail,
hmr: Vûr intling khâwmnahaia chun i lût ta hlak am? Annawleh, riel intling khâwmnahai chu i hmu ta hlak am?

en: Which I have reserved against the time of trouble, Against the day of battle and war?
hmr: Chuong buoina huna dinga ka khêkhai le, Indona le intukna nia dinga ka khêkhai chu?

en: By what way is the light parted, Or the east wind scattered upon the earth?
hmr: Ieng lampui âm var hi a fein, Annawleh, hnuoi chunga hin ieng lampui âm sak thli hi a hrâng hlak a?

en: Who hath cleft a channel for the waterflood, Or the way for the lightning of the thunder;
hmr: “Tuin am tuilien ta dinga ruom le, Ṭêk ta ding a lampui a siem a?

en: To cause it to rain on a land where no man is; On the wilderness, wherein there is no man;
hmr: Mi um nawna ram le, Mi um nawna thlalêra ruo insûrtir ding le.

en: To satisfy the waste and desolate ground, And to cause the tender grass to spring forth?
hmr: Leihnuoi râusan ta le, se ta chu sukkhawp ding le, Hlohna innêm chu hung inmâwngtir dingin?

en: Hath the rain a father? Or who hath begotten the drops of dew?
hmr: Ruo hin pa a nei am? Annawleh, daidaw malhai hi tuin am a hung thlâk a na?

en: Out of whose womb came the ice? And the hoary frost of heaven, who hath gendered it?
hmr: Tu phîng sûnga inthawkin am vûr chu a hung pieng a na? Vâna inthawka vûrsûr inphi sung sung chu tuin am ân pieng tir leh?

en: The waters hide themselves and become like stone, And the face of the deep is frozen.
hmr: Tuihai chu lung angin a ngar a, Li inthûk chungzâwl chu sukkhalin a um tah a.

en: Canst thou bind the cluster of the Pleiades, Or loose the bands of Orion?
hmr: Siruk inbâwr chu nangin khuop thei i ti? Sizucho khuopnahai chu i sût thei ding am a nih?

en: Canst thou lead forth the Mazzaroth in their season? Or canst thou guide the Bear with her train?
hmr: Mazzaroth chu an hun sengah i hung ṭhuoi suok thei ding maw? Annawleh, Zângkhuohai i ṭhuoi thei ding maw?

en: Knowest thou the ordinances of the heavens? Canst thou establish the dominion thereof in the earth?
hmr: Vânhaia thuruothai chu i hriet vawng am? Hnuoi chunga hin thu în neitir thei ding am a nih?

en: Canst thou lift up thy voice to the clouds, That abundance of waters may cover thee?
hmr: “Sûmhai chu i râwlin ko thei i ti, Ruopui vânâwnin a sûrkhumna ding chein?

en: Canst thou send forth lightnings, that they may go, And say unto thee, Here we are?
hmr: Kâwlinlephai chu an feh a, ‘Hitaka hin kan um,’ i kuoma ti dingin, I tir suok thei ding am a nih?

en: Who hath put wisdom in the inward parts? Or who hath given understanding to the mind?
hmr: Sûngril bung hranhaia chun tuin am varna a sieh a? Annawleh, lungvara hrietna chu tuin am a pêk a?

en: Who can number the clouds by wisdom? Or who can pour out the bottles of heaven,
hmr: Varna ngawtin tuin am sûmhai chu a tiem sêng a? Vâna penghai chu tuin am bunthla thei a ta?

en: When the dust runneth into a mass, And the clods cleave fast together?
hmr: Iengtik âm pilvut chu an hung inhlawmin, A hlawmhai chu an hung inchâr tlat a?

en: Canst thou hunt the prey for the lioness, Or satisfy the appetite of the young lions,
hmr: Sakeibakneipui chu a safâk ding i zawngpêk ding am a nih? Annawleh, sakeibaknei vânglai phîngṭâm chu i sukkhawp thei am a nih?

en: When they couch in their dens, And abide in the covert to lie in wait?
hmr: An pûk sûnga chun an bawk a, An kuoahai chun an inchân hlak laiin?

en: Who provideth for the raven his prey, When his young ones cry unto God, And wander for lack of food?
hmr: A têhai chu Pathien kuomah an khêk a, Fâk ding tlasama an umin Vaâk chu tuin am fâk ding a pêk a?
